intro: Roella ciliata var. dregeana, commonly known as the velvetleaf or African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant is often cultivated as a ornamental due to its attractive foliage and blooms. It prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for both indoor and outdoor gardens. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a model species for studying plant adaptation and hybridization in the Rubiaceae family.
